about.short: Wander365 is a travel platform that helps people explore curated trips, send enquiries, and get a quick response while the team manages leads, packages, and itineraries from one CRM. The brand is set up to evolve into WanderRest without a rebuild.
about.long:
Wander365 makes planning Indian getaways feel guided instead of chaotic. The public site highlights destinations, day-wise plans, and enquiry flows so visitors can raise a trip request in minutes.

Behind the site, an admin CRM tracks leads, packages, and itineraries so the team can reply faster and reuse templates. The product and brand are structured so it can rebrand to WanderRest smoothly or be white-labeled for other agencies.

roles_and_responsibilities: Shaped the product direction and UX for both the customer site and the CRM.
Designed UI components and flows for enquiries, itineraries, and pricing.
Built the frontend, APIs, and data models for leads, packages, and quotes.
Set up SEO architecture, analytics hooks, and rebrand-ready assets.
objectives: Present Wander365 as a trustworthy travel brand with clear packages and itineraries.
Capture enquiries into a simple CRM instead of scattered chats and sheets.
Keep the platform flexible for a future WanderRest rebrand or white-label offering.

public_website: Browse by destination or theme with detailed package pages and FAQs.
Day-wise itineraries with inclusions/exclusions and gallery.
Enquiry forms tied to the CRM with source and UTM tracking.
SEO-friendly guides and shareable links for WhatsApp and email.
admin_crm: Lead inbox with simple status pipeline and filters by source.
Package and itinerary templates with seasonal pricing options.
Quote/export flow for quick responses and client-ready PDFs.
Light reporting on leads, destinations, and channels.

frontend: Angular SPA with responsive blocks for packages and enquiries.
backend: REST API (Node.js / Django / FastAPI) with role-based access.
Structured models for leads, packages, itineraries, and pricing.
database: Relational DB (PostgreSQL/MySQL) or Firestore depending on deployment.
integrations: WhatsApp-ready share links and email notifications.
Google Analytics with UTM-based campaign tracking.
Planned Google Business Profile focus for reviews and discovery.
hosting_devops: Backend containerized on VPS/cloud with environment separation.
Basic CI/CD for automated builds and deployments.

discovery_and_strategy.summary: Positioned Wander365, scoped features, and set the platform architecture.

design_and_ux.summary: Created user flows, wireframes, and visual design for the site and CRM.

development_v1.summary: Built the core website, enquiry flow, and admin CRM ahead of launch.

launch_v1.summary: Soft launch with core booking enquiry and CRM live for real users.

full_launch.summary: Public rollout with stabilized features and content push.

future_rebrand.summary: Prepare brand and UX shifts to WanderRest without disrupting data or users.

budget.notes: Equivalent value for strategy, UX/UI, development, and initial SEO, with room to rebrand into WanderRest.

challenges: Operations and follow-ups were scattered across chats and spreadsheets.
Team needed an easy CRM without technical overhead.
The platform had to allow a later WanderRest rebrand without a rebuild.
solutions: Built a pared-down CRM with reusable templates and a simple status pipeline.
Abstracted brand assets and copy so Wander365 can evolve into WanderRest.
Structured data models and SEO-ready content to standardize responses.

qualitative: Centralized leads and packages in one system instead of chats and sheets.
Faster responses using templated itineraries and quote exports.
Brand and tech ready to evolve into WanderRest or a white-label offering.
outcomes.example_metrics_note: Early usage focuses on enquiry handling and response speed; public metrics can be added after the WanderRest rollout.
